title: Commending Firefighter Roe Knapp upon the occasion of his designation for special recognition for 30 years of dedicated service to Winona Lake Fire Engine Company Number 2
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending Firefighter Roe Knapp upon the occa-
sion of his designation for special recognition after 30 years of  dedi-
cated service to Winona Lake Fire Engine Company Number 2

WHEREAS,  The firefighters of New York State are renowned throughout the
Nation; their reputation is synonymous with excellence  in  the  arduous
field of fire protection and prevention; and
  WHEREAS,  Since  the  early  days  of "teapot steamers," the volunteer
firefighter has been the cornerstone of our great  Nation's  efforts  to
spare us from the ravages of fire; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend
Firefighter  Roe  Knapp upon the occasion of his designation for special
recognition after 30 years of dedicated  service  to  Winona  Lake  Fire
Engine  Company Number 2; this auspicious occasion will be celebrated on
Saturday, February 5, 2011, at  the  Annual  Installation  of  Officers'
Dinner  to  be  held  at  the Engine Company's banquet hall at 104 South
Plank Road in Newburgh, New York; and
  WHEREAS, Firefighter Roe Knapp has devoted over 30  years  of  distin-
guished service to Winona Lake Fire Engine Company Number 2; and
  WHEREAS,  For  the  duration  of  his 30 years of dedicated service to
Winona Lake Fire Engine Company Number  2,  Firefighter  Roe  Knapp  has
distinguished himself by representing the Company as Parade Leader; and
  WHEREAS,  Volunteer firefighters and fire departments not only provide
the critical service of fire protection but also engage in other  activ-
ities of great benefit and importance to the communities they serve; and
  WHEREAS, It takes a special dedication, a strong desire to help others
and  a  tireless sense of community to forsake precious time with family
and friends to respond to the signal that a neighbor  is  in  need;  Roe
Knapp  is  such  a  firefighter;  throughout  his  many years of devoted
service, this volunteer heroically performed, above and beyond the  call
of   duty,   those  responsibilities  which  define  the  task  of  fire
protection; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commend  Firefighter  Roe Knapp upon the occasion of his designation for
special recognition after 30 years of dedicated service to  Winona  Lake
Fire Engine Company Number 2; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Firefighter Roe Knapp.
